required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study Of SIBP-01 Or CN-Trastuzumab Plus Docetaxel And Carboplatin In HER2 Positive Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Randomized, Single-blind Study Comparing the Efficacy, Safety, and Immunogenicity of SIBP-01 and CN-Trastuzumab Combination With Docetaxel and Carboplatin in Patients With Early or Locally Advanced Her2 Positive Breast Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The study will compare PK, efficacy, safety, and immunogenicity of SIBP-01 (Trastuzumab Biosimilar) in combination with Docetaxel and Carboplatin versus Herceptin® (CN-Trastuzumab) approved in the CN in combination with Docetaxel and Carboplatin in patients with operable HER2 positive, with early or locally advanced HER2-positive breast cancer. The hypothesis to be tested in this study is the tpCR of patients with Cycle 6 of SIBP-01 is similar to CN-approved trastuzumab, using a 90% bilateral confidence interval between 0.74 and 1.5.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Multi-center, randomized, single-blind, positive drug parallel controlled equivalence clinical trial.

primary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of Cycle 6(each cycle is 3 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Total Pathologic Complete Response (tpCR) Defined as the Absence of Invasive Neoplastic Cells in the Breast and Lymph Nodes(ypT0/is, ypN0). Following surgery after treatment completion, tumors were assessed as Complete Pathological Response, Partial Pathological Response, or No Pathological Response..The tpCR was assessed by the Independent Response Evaluation Committee (IREC)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of Cycle 6(each cycle is 3 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Pathologic Complete Response (pCR) Defined as the Absence of Invasive Neoplastic Cells in the Breast and Lymph Nodes(ypT0/is). Following surgery after treatment completion, tumors were assessed as Complete Pathological Response, Partial Pathological Response, or No Pathological Response.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with steady-state trough concentration (Ctrough, ss) > 20 μg/mL
secondary_outcome.time_frame: after 5 cycles of treatment ( before cycle 6, each cycle is 3 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: proportion of patients with Ctrough, ss> 20 μg/mL after 5 cycles of administration (before cycle 6) accounting for all subjects with PK blood samples collected in each treatment group

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycles 1 through 6 ( each cycle is 3 weeks )
secondary_outcome.description: Samples of blood were taken pre-dose on Cycles 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, and 6, and at 0, 2, 4, 8, 72, 168, 336 hour post dose on Cycles 5 and 21 days post dose on cycle 6 for pharmacokinetic evaluation.

arm_group.description: SIBP-01→ Docetaxel→ Carboplatin: injection, every 3 weeks for 18 weeks; SIBP-01: first dose 8mg/kg, then 6mg/kg; Docetaxel: dose 75mg/m2; Carboplatin: dose AUC6
Herceptin→ Docetaxel→ Carboplatin: injection, every 3 weeks for 18 weeks; Herceptin: first dose 8mg/kg, then 6mg/kg; Docetaxel: dose 75mg/m2; Carboplatin: dose AUC6

intervention.description: IBP-01: injection; strength: 150mg; first dose 8mg/kg (intravenous infusion, not less than 90 minutes, on the 1st day of each cycle), then 6mg/kg once every 3 weeks, totaling 6 cycles
Herceptin: injection; strength: 440mg; first dose 8mg/kg (intravenous infusion, not less than 90 minutes, on the 1st day of each cycle), then 6mg/kg once every 3 weeks, totaling 6 cycles
Docetaxel: injection; dose 75mg/m2, 75mg/m2 once every 3 weeks (intravenous infusion, not less than 60 minutes, on the 1st day of each cycle), totaling 6 cycles;
Carboplatin: injection; dose AUC6, AUC6 once every 3 weeks (intravenous infusion, not less than 30 minutes, on the 1st day of each cycle), totaling 6 cycles;

eligibility.gender_description: Female patients with HER2-positive breast cancer

overall_official.last_name: Shanghai Institute Of Biological Products Co., Ltd

results_reference.citation: Sugitani I, Ueda S, Sakurai T, Shigekawa T, Hirokawa E, Shimada H, Takeuchi H, Matsuura K, Misumi M, Fujiuchi N, Takahashi T, Hasebe T, Osaki A, Saeki T. Neoadjuvant chemotherapy with trastuzumab, docetaxel, and carboplatin administered every 3 weeks for Japanese women with HER2-positive primary breast cancer: efficacy and safety. Int J Clin Oncol. 2017 Oct;22(5):880-886. doi: 10.1007/s10147-017-1136-8. Epub 2017 May 25.

Lammers PE, Dank M, Masetti R, Abbas R, Hilton F, Coppola J, Jacobs I. Neoadjuvant PF-05280014 (a potential trastuzumab biosimilar) versus trastuzumab for operable HER2+ breast cancer. Br J Cancer. 2018 Aug;119(3):266-273. doi: 10.1038/s41416-018-0147-1. Epub 2018 Jul 13.
